title: Replace custom contact form with embedded Google Forms

requirements.text: Replace the ContactForm component implementation with an embedded Google Forms iframe that includes fields for name, phone, email, jurisdiction (dropdown with options: Hyderabad, Secunderabad, Rangareddy, Cyberabad), practice area (dropdown with options: Family Law, Corporate Law, Criminal Defense, Civil Law, Property Law), and message

quotes: enable google forms instead of our built in form in the website with same set of questions

acceptanceCriteria: ContactForm.tsx component renders a Google Forms iframe instead of custom form elements
The embedded Google Form contains all original fields: name, phone, email, jurisdiction, practice area, and message
The iframe is responsive and maintains consistent styling with the rest of the site
Form submissions go directly to Google Forms instead of the backend canister

requirements.text: Update the ContactPage to display the Google Forms embedded form with appropriate styling and layout that matches the luxury legal theme
acceptanceCriteria: ContactPage.tsx renders the updated ContactForm component with Google Forms embed
The embedded form maintains visual consistency with the deep navy and gold color scheme
Contact information cards remain visible alongside the Google Form

requirements.text: Update all jurisdiction-specific pages (Hyderabad, Secunderabad, Rangareddy, Cyberabad) to use the Google Forms embedded contact form instead of the custom form
acceptanceCriteria: JurisdictionPage.tsx component renders the Google Forms embed
Each jurisdiction page displays the same Google Form with consistent styling
Jurisdiction-specific content remains visible above or alongside the form

requirements.text: Update ServiceDetailPage to use the Google Forms embedded contact form instead of the custom ContactForm component
acceptanceCriteria: ServiceDetailPage.tsx renders the Google Forms embed
Service details and benefits remain visible above the form
Form styling is consistent with the page layout

constraints: Do not modify backend/main.mo or any backend logic
The Google Forms URL must be provided by the user or use a placeholder that can be easily replaced
nonGoals: Removing the backend contact form submission storage functionality
Removing the leads page or admin dashboard
Creating a new Google Form (user must provide their own Google Forms URL)
Implementing form validation in the frontend (Google Forms handles this)
